titles.title: HP179 The royal banners forward go

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
The royal banners forward go,
The myst'ry of the cross to show,
When he in flesh, all flesh who made,
Is on the tree of death displayed.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
For us he bore those pains severe,
The cruel wounds, the soldier's spear;
By blood and water from his side
Our souls from sin are purified.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Fulfilled is now what David told
In faithful prophet's song of old,
Inviting all the world to see:
Our God has suffered on the tree!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
O tree, most beautiful, most glad,
O tree in royal purple clad,
Chosen from noble stock to bear
The holy limbs that suffer there!

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
O tree, on whose blest arms is laid
The price that has the balance swayed,
Our souls from slav'ry to regain,
And rescue us from hell's domain!

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
To thee, eternal Three in One
Let homage due by all be done;
Whom by the cross thou dost restore,
Preserve and govern evermore.
Amen.
